titleStmt.title: James F. Buckner et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5655

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hopkinsville Ky
Feby 7th 1864
His Excellency
Gov Thos, E, Bramlett
Dear Sir

At the last March term of the Christian Circuit Court a Judgement was rendered by said Court agst Coleman Dunnin for twenty dollars for selling liquor without license Said Dunnin is an Old man whose wife is dead & who has dependant on him for support several small children He is poor & owns no property & hires himself out as a laborer to make a support for himself & children A capias is now in the hands of the Sheriff & unless said fine is remitted said Dunnin will have to ^go go to^ jail as the only means of satisfying the fine and under the circumstances we think a remission of the fine would be proper. We ask a remission of his fine.

James F Buckner
H, R, Littell County Judge
G H Lawson " Clerk
Joab Clark Cir Clerk

Christian Cir Ct
vs
C Dunnin
Remit --
Tipling
$20
12th July 64
